Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 01:51PM mmb1 wrote: Thanks Lynne and Tami, I always do better when I know what to expect.  I'll let you know how it goes tomorrow. MM
Posts.Title: Mammotome on Thursday mmb1 mmb1

Posts.Content: mmb1 wrote: Hello BC sisters My last mammogram (on my remaining breast) with a US follow-up showed microcalcifications BI-RADS 4C.  I have a Mammotome biopsy scheduled for this Thursday.  I know how a US guided core biopy feels (not too bad), but am looking for a little input from those of you who have had the mammotome.  I'm told the worst part is laying still with your boob hanging down through the hole. Feeling pretty "crazy" right now. Just want to get it over with and have them say the lovely B9 word. MM This too shall pass... Dx 11/31/2005, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mammotome on Thursday mmb1 mmb1

Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 09:39AM mmb1 wrote: I have the great news of B9!!!   The procedure went fine, some discomfort, no pain to speak of, took about two hours. Called the radiologist on Friday and got the GREAT B9 reoprt. Thanks to all for your support. MM
